meanings.definition: Substances that protect biological tissue from damage caused by freezing.
meanings.sent1: The cryoprotectants helped preserve the cells during the freezing process.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use cryoprotectants to keep tissues safe from harm when frozen.
meanings.sent3: The cryoprotectants were like tiny shields, defending the cells from the cold.
meanings.sent4: In the icy realm of cryopreservation, cryoprotectants act as guardians of cellular integrity.
meanings.sent5: The importance of cryoprotectants in safeguarding tissues from freezing cannot be overstated.

meanings.definition: Agents used to prevent ice formation in cells during cryopreservation.
meanings.sent1: Adding cryoprotectants to the solution stopped ice from forming in the cells.
meanings.sent2: The cryoprotectants were crucial in maintaining cell viability by preventing ice formation.
meanings.sent3: The cryoprotectants were like ice-fighting superheroes, saving the cells from freezing.
meanings.sent4: Just as a shield deflects arrows, cryoprotectants deflect ice crystals in cryopreservation.
meanings.sent5: The cryoprotectants worked tirelessly to keep the cells ice-free during cryopreservation.
